AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: Responses are largely template-driven (apologies + long checklists + KB links) with limited concrete investigation, and they include mismatched/low-value asks (e.g., repeated video request) rather than progressing the case. The AI also asserts the issue is 'not an obvious hardware failure' repeatedly without demonstrating analysis beyond 'it rebooted'.
evidence: “Dear Tomas, Thank you for following up... We will prioritize resolving this issue for you. To proceed, we kindly ask you to provide the following details for a comprehensive RMA assessment:”
“For a complete list of required information, please review the instructions on Requesting RMA for a Hardware Box [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/120394].”
“Since the unit powers on and recovers after a reboot (indicating no clear hardware failure), please perform the following: 1) Run the Kerio Control hardware diagnostic tool...”
“To advance with warranty verification/RMA and expedite resolution, kindly provide the following details: ... A video recording depicting the reported behavior...”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer is repeatedly asked for the same RMA details and artifacts even after providing attachments and later providing shipping/contact info; the customer explicitly pushes back that they already provided/it is readable, and expresses frustration about the process for a remote site.
evidence: Customer: “This in unacceptable. The unit is located remote and we cannot drive there every week to do some HW diagnostics tools.”
Customer: “I have no idea SN. You can propably find it via last ticket 60235438 where was RMA located.”
Support (later, again): “To proceed with warranty verification and a potential RMA, we kindly request the following details: ... Serial number ... A video recording...”
Customer: “SN is cleary readable from the photo - green sticker. Do you mean something else?”
Support (again): “Serial Number ... please either type the Serial Number in your message or send a close-up photo...”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support repeatedly requests information that was already provided in-ticket (attachments for S/N, then shipping/contact details) and does not effectively acknowledge constraints (remote location, no video captured during incident) while continuing to require the same items.
evidence: Customer: “SN is in attachment.”
Support: “the two SN photos were unreadable, so please either type the Serial Number... or send a close-up photo...”
Customer: “No video/photo from this incident was taken.”
Support (still): “A video recording depicting the reported behavior (a brief phone video capturing LED status and the unresponsive Web UI will be sufficient)”
Customer: “We do all the IT issues for them. So the RMA shipping and all the thing is to our company address as in last ticket.”
Customer (later provides it anyway): “Shipping: ApSo spol. s r.o., Tomas Ruzicka ... Czech republic ... +420604915369”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: All exchanges occur within the same day with responses occurring within minutes to ~1 hour; there are no multi-day gaps or 'still waiting' follow-ups.
evidence: [2025-12-04T08:52:52+00:00] Customer update followed by [2025-12-04T08:59:43+00:00] support reply
[2025-12-04T09:18:26+00:00] Customer message followed by [2025-12-04T09:20:17+00:00] internal summary

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The transcript does not show the ticket being closed or auto-closed; the interaction is ongoing with the customer asking scheduling questions and providing shipping info.
evidence: Customer: “Can the firebird be done via VPN or it must be from computer onsite?... Are you 24/7 service or do we have some time window?”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: This is a recurring outage affecting WAN/VPN/Internet access at a customer office shortly after an RMA replacement, yet support primarily follows a standard RMA checklist and repeats diagnostic/factory reset steps rather than visibly escalating or offering a high-touch immediate remediation path (e.g., rapid escalation/engineering review, replacement authorization given repeat failure).
evidence: Customer: “Web UI unresponsive. WAN down.”
Customer: “no VPN connection from our side and clients in the office could not reach the internet via WAN.”
Customer: “We have NG120 from RMA and it failed after week again.”
Support: “Since the unit powers on and recovers after rebooting... please complete the following... Run the ... diagnostic tool... perform a factory reset and full system recovery...”
Customer: “This in unacceptable. The unit is located remote and we cannot drive there every week...”
